{{location infobox | name=Westfold | image=The Lord of the Rings Online - Westfold.jpg | caption=Westfold in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'' | pronun= | othernames= | location=Western [[Rohan]], skirting the [[White Mountains]] | type=Region | description=Slopes and fields | regions= | towns= | inhabitants=[[Rohirrim]] | created= | destroyed= | events=[[First Battle of the Fords of Isen]]
[[Second Battle of the Fords of Isen]]
[[Battle of the Hornburg]] }} The '''Westfold''' was a region of slopes and fields{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Westfold'', p. 413 in the west of [[Rohan]], between the river [[Isen]] in the west and the region called the [[Folde]] in the east,{{HM|N}}, entry '''Folde''', pp. 770-71 the [[White Mountains]] in the south{{UT|Map}} and the walls of [[Isengard]] and the eaves of [[Fangorn Forest]] in the north.{{UT|11c}}, third and fifth paragraph of the long note The [[Great West Road]] ran through the Westfold north of the White Mountains from the [[Fords of Isen]] to the Folde and [[Edoras]]. In the south of the Westfold lay the Westfold Vale, a great bay in the northernmost arm of the White Mountains with the [[Deeping-coomb]] and the [[Helm's Deep]], the stronghold of the Westfold, at its southern end.{{TT|Deep}}, p. 528{{WR|1|II}}, p. 12 The Men who lived in the Westfold were called [[Westfold-men]]{{TT|Deep}}, pp. 531, 536 and 538{{TT|Road}}, p. 543 or Westfolders.{{TT|Deep}}, p. 532 ==History== The Westfold was originally part of the realm of [[Gondor]] until in {{TA|2510}} the fief of [[Calenardhon]] was granted to [[Eorl]] the Young by the [[Ruling Steward]] [[Cirion]]. Thereafter the Westfold was part of Rohan.{{UT|Eorl}} In {{TA|2758}} the [[Dunlendings]] led by [[Wulf]] overran Rohan and King [[Helm]] took refuge in Helm's Deep.{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 2758, p. 1088 During the subsequent [[Long Winter]] first prince [[Háma]] and then Helm made sorties and forays into the Westfold for food and to attack their besiegers. Both men died in the snow.{{App|Eorl}}, pp. 1066-67 [[File:Mark Fisher - Westfold.png|thumb|left|200px|Map of the Westfold]] In the beginning of {{TA|3019}} when the forces of the wizard [[Saruman]] invaded Rohan, [[Théodred]], the son of King [[Théoden]], was the [[Second Marshal of the Riddermark]] with his base at Helm's Deep and was in command of the forces of the [[West-mark]]. When actual war began Théodred assumed the overall command, ordered the summoning of a [[Muster of Edoras]] and ordered [[Elfhelm]] to reinforce the Muster of Westfold with four companies of riders from the Muster of Edoras{{UT|Isen}} to defend against the invading forces.{{UT|11b}}, writing concerning the Marshals of the Mark, first and second paragraph On [[25 February]] the [[First Battle of the Fords of Isen]] was fought.{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, Februar 25, p. 1092 In this fight the sole objective of Saruman was to slay Théodred; had his forces invaded the Westfold immediately after this battle Rohan would have suffered grievously. Instead, Saruman's army withdrew and did not return until [[2 March]] to fight the [[Second Battle of the Fords of Isen]].{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 2, p. 1093 Following the fall of Théodred, command in the West-mark was assumed by [[Erkenbrand]], who was Lord of [[Deeping-coomb]] and much of the rest of the Westfold. In the Second Battle, the forces of Erkenbrand were scattered and Saruman's host marched through the Westfold to attack the [[Hornburg]]. However, in the [[Battle of the Hornburg]] all of the enemies were crushed.{{TT|Deep}}, pp. 540-42 After the fall of [[Sauron]] the funeral escort of King Théoden rode to Edoras. Subsequently, the remaining members of the [[Fellowship of the Ring]] travelled through the Westfold from [[14 August]] to [[22 August]] when King [[Aragorn|Elessar]] took his leave.{{App|Chief}}, entry for the year 3019, August 14 to 22, p. 1095 ==Etymology== ''Westfold'' is a name in the language of Rohan. It is a combination of "West" and ''fold'' from [[Old English]] ''folde'' ("earth", "land", "country"). ==Other versions of the legendarium== According to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s [[Unfinished index]] for [[The Lord of the Rings]] and [[Christopher Tolkien]]'s index of [[Unfinished Tales]] the Westfold are "the slopes and fields" between [[Thrihyrne]] and [[Edoras]].{{UT|Index}} entry ''Westfold'' However, the river Isen is located west of the ''Thrihyrne'', which is at the head of the valley of Helm's Deep,{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Thrihyrne'', p. 412 and although the western boundary of the ''Folde'' is not indicated, the ''Folde'' was the centre of the kingdom of Rohan. On the [[First Map of The Lord of the Rings]] a label called ''Westfold'' was placed in a western valley in the south of the [[Misty Mountains]] where Dunland is now located on the final published maps, but it was struck out afterwards.{{TI|MIVd}}, map square N10, p. 319 In an earlier manuscript version of the chapter Helm's Deep the men in the service of Saruman who attacked the Rohirrim at the Fords of Isen{{WR|1|II}}, p. 8 and at Helm's Deep came from this ''Westfold'' and cried in the tongue of Westfold.{{WR|1|II}}, p. 8 and p. 21 ==Portrayal in adaptations== ===The Westfold in adaptations=== File:The Lord of the Rings - The Two Towers - Westfold.jpg|The Westfold in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]'' File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Westfold map.jpg|Map of Westfold in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'' '''2013: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':''' :Westfold is the area of [[Westemnet|West Rohan]] lying between [[Edoras]] and [[Helm's Deep]]. It also contains the town of [[Grimslade]] and the village of "Marton". {{references}} [[Category:Regions of Rohan]] [[fr:encyclo/geographie/regions/rohan/westfold]]
